column4: I have an Inspiron 17r with a fresh install of Ubuntu 10.4.  The internal speakers work fine, but when I plug in headphones, they go mute and no sound comes out of the headphones.  Any advice?
are they regular headphones or USB?
did they work before with another OS?
Standard audio jack.  The hardware is functional.
do you have a headphone jack in the front and back of your computer (ie) one direct to the sound card? Have you tried *both* jacks
There is only one audio jack on the side of my laptop.
have you checked all the volume settings in preferences?
try running alsamixer as well
I ran alsamixer and gave every volume setting a 50% or so.  The problem persisted.
lspci for your sound card and google the name of it with linux or ubuntu linux
see if anyone has had the same issue
if not, i'd file a bug.
On it.

I apparently have two audio cards.  One is a "00:1b.0 Audio device: Intel Corporation 5 Series/3400 Series Chipset High Definition Audio (rev 06)" and the other is a "02:00.1 Audio device: ATI Technologies Inc Manhattan HDMI Audio [Mobility Radeon HD 5000 Series]"
Is this relevant?
interesting
lets take a look at that
preferences->sound->hardware
go there
how many devices do you see
I'm there.  Both are listed, but there doesn't seem to be much to change.
